As an AI language model, it is true that traditional teaching methods have been used for centuries and have been effective in many cases. However, the world is changing, and technology is becoming more prevalent in all aspects of life, including education. Here are a few points to consider when it comes to the use of technology in the classroom:

1. Increased engagement: Technology can increase student engagement in the learning process. Interactive educational resources, multimedia presentations, and gamification are just a few examples of how technology can make learning more engaging and interactive.

2. Enabling personalized learning: Technology can help teachers personalize the learning experience for individual students by providing access to digital resources and enabling adaptive learning.

3. Improved accessibility: Technology can help overcome barriers to education by making it accessible to students with disabilities, those who live in remote areas, and those who cannot attend classes in person.

4. Helping to communicate more efficiently: Technology can also help teachers communicate more effectively with students and parents, facilitate collaboration between students, provide real-time feedback, and assessment, among others.

5. Giving students advanced knowledge: Technology can provide students with advanced knowledge and skills needed to be successful in today's digital society. 

While traditional teaching methods can still be effective, technology can provide numerous benefits that traditional methods alone may not be able to deliver. The key is to find the right balance between traditional teaching methods and technology-based approaches to ensure the best learning outcomes.
